lines.text:
[speaking about Louise]
I wanted to make her laugh, and she wouldn't laugh! I wanted to make her like me, and she wouldn't like me! Oh, I've failed!
He takes my hand, like this... Then he wants to swing hands, like this. But I don't let him.
Uh-huh. It's sinful, but it's awfully thrilling. For a long time I don't let him.
Until in the end, I let him. The we walk along swinging hands, up and down, up and down, just like this. That's passionate love.

[to Liliom]
The memory of you makes them much happier than you could ever make them.
It's possible for someone to beat you, and beat you, and beat you, and it not hurt at all.
Women like Julie are endlessly faithful. It's touching. It's mysterious.

[to Liliom]
Go away, you crazy man!

[to Marie, who is engaged to Wolf]
Have you ever experienced passionate love with Wolf?
Aren't you afraid of me... that I'll take your money away from you?
Oh, I haven't got any. But if I did, I'd give it all to you.

[speaking about the bad-tempered Mme. Muscat]
I ain't never beat up a woman yet... well, almost never.

[to Julie]
I beat you, not because I was mad at you, but because I couldn't bear to see you cry. But I'm not asking forgiveness. I don't do that, I don't. I'll have to go on the train alone.
He hit me. I heard the sound of it. But it didn't hurt, Mother. It felt just like a kiss... Tell me Mother, has anyone ever hit you without hurting you in the least?
Yes dear. It's happened to me too.
Can anyone hit you real hard and loud, without hurting you at all?
Yes, dear. It's possible for someone to beat you and beat you and beat you, and not hurt you at all.
